words.defineVi: cấu trúc xương hỗ trợ cơ thể của một con vật hoặc một người

examples: A shiver ran down my spine.
That song always sends a shiver down my spine.
I felt a chill up my spine.
A shiver runs up my spine when I listen to a beautiful Beethoven symphony.
A cold chill ran down my spine when I heard his angry voice.
words.defineEn: the row of small bones that are joined together down the center of the back of the body
words.defineVi: hàng xương nhỏ được nối với nhau xuống trung tâm của mặt sau của cơ thể

examples: You may also stretch your external sphincter muscles.
It’s one of many sphincters on your body.
The internal urethral sphincter automatically and involuntarily opens, and the urine is released.
But your anal sphincter is rare among muscles, spending basically every moment of your life fully flexed.
And when you voluntarily relax your external anal sphincter, the stool is finally expelled.
words.defineEn: (anatomy) a ring of muscle that can open or close an opening, such as anus, in the body
words.defineVi: (giải phẫu) một vòng cơ có thể mở hoặc đóng một lỗ, chẳng hạn như hậu môn, trong cơ thể

examples: Is that, like, the sternum?
It was all in my sternum, in my breast, in my lungs, in my liver, in my spine.
Arbery is hit in the chest, his right lung, ribs, and sternum are injured.
In fact, it is their rib cage, and their spine, and their vertebrae, and their sternum.
Spongy bone tissue is typically found in the heads of long bones and in the inner layer of flat bones like the sternum.
words.defineEn: (anatomy) a long flat bone at the center of the chest that connects the ribs to the shoulder girdle
words.defineVi: (giải phẫu) xương dẹt dài ở giữa ngực nối các xương sườn với đai vai

examples: The young boy who once came home after a trip to a museum and proudly presented his horrified mother with a small dinosaur tail bone he had smuggled home in his pocket.
words.defineEn: the small triangular bone at the end of the spinal column in humans or tailless primates
words.defineVi: xương hình tam giác nhỏ ở phần cuối của cột sống ở người hoặc động vật linh trưởng cụt đuôi

examples: This group, which includes humans, walks with the podials and the tarsals flat on the ground all at once.
words.defineEn: (anatomy) any of the cluster of seven small bones in the foot between the ankle and upper foot
words.defineVi: (giải phẫu) bất kỳ cụm bảy xương nhỏ nào ở bàn chân giữa mắt cá chân và bàn chân trên

examples: In the Little Badlands of Nebraska in 1962, a couple of workers discovered a large thighbone while surveying for a dam.
Based on its fossils, including a partial jaw and thighbone, naturalist William Buckland described it in 1824 as a huge lizard that was probably amphibious.
words.defineEn: the longest bone in the human skeleton which is between the hip and the knee
words.defineVi: xương dài nhất trong bộ xương người nằm giữa hông và đầu gối

examples: Even better evidence for bipedalism in this species comes from the shin bone, the tibia.
- It's a tibia just like us?
This is the top of the tibia and then behind it is the joint bone, the fibula.
The lower part of the leg has two separate bones, which are the tibia and the fibula.
Because, in humans, the tibia comes straight up from the ankle, better for standing upright.
words.defineEn: (anatomy) the inner and larger of the two bones between the ankle and the knee
words.defineVi: (giải phẫu) phần trong và phần lớn hơn của hai xương giữa mắt cá và đầu gối

words.defineEn: (anatomy) the three-headed muscle of the arm that functions as the extensor of the elbow joint
words.defineVi: (giải phẫu) cơ ba đầu của cánh tay có chức năng duỗi khớp khuỷu tay

examples: So this is the ulna from the small animal.
The pivot joint between your radius and ulna allow you to rotate your palm forward or anteriorly in a motion called supination, and turning it backward or posteriorly is called pronation.
This is an ulna right here, which is part of one the arm bones.
All these motions use gliding, or plane joints, like the one between the distal ends of your radius and ulna, and the carpal bones of your wrist.
When you pronate your hand like this, you've got two bones in your arm, the radius and the ulna.
words.defineEn: (anatomy) the thinner and longer bone of the human forearm extending from the elbow to the wrist
words.defineVi: (giải phẫu) xương cẳng tay người mỏng hơn và dài hơn kéo dài từ khuỷu tay đến cổ tay

examples: Coming up slowly, one vertebra at a time.
With the use of the towel, slowly roll down one vertebra at a time.
It was a strange-looking vertebra, one that resembled that same bone from an anaconda, but way bigger.
Sereno’s team concluded that the vertebra was from a freshwater fish called Lycoptera, which is known from the late Jurassic to the Early Cretaceous, or about 150 to 130 million years ago.
Buried in the sediment between its bones was the single vertebra of a fish, and this bone is what paleontologists have used to try to determine Raptorex’s age.
words.defineEn: (anatomy) any of the bony segments and cartilages of the spinal column
words.defineVi: (giải phẫu) bất kỳ đoạn xương và sụn nào của cột sống

examples: Ossicles first show up in a turtle from Saudi Arabia around 56 million years ago called Arabemys.
Like Arabemys and later skin-shells, it has hundreds of ossicles in its shell.
Ossicles may provide some degree of protection, but some researchers think they might also play a role in calcium regulation.
Then, other species with ossicles kept popping up all over - from Africa to New Zealand, and even Antarctica.
From there, sound vibrations are amplified by the so-called 'ossicle bones', which also happen to be the most awesomely named bones in your body: the stirrup, the hammer and the anvil.
words.defineEn: a small bone found in the middle ear that helps transmit sound vibrations and facilitate hearing
words.defineVi: một xương nhỏ được tìm thấy ở tai giữa giúp truyền các rung động âm thanh và tạo điều kiện thuận lợi cho việc nghe

examples: You, for example, have one pair of temporal fenestra in your skull, because you, my friend, are a synapsid.
Synapsids had one pair of openings in the skull, called a temporal fenestra, while the Sauropsids had two pairs.
words.defineEn: an opening or a hole, particularly in a bone structure
words.defineVi: một lỗ hoặc một lỗ, đặc biệt là trong cấu trúc xương

examples: The lion's powerful jaws allowed it to tear apart its prey.
She wore a chin strap to protect her jaw during sports activities.
Our jaws dropped when we found out how much they were paying in rent.
My jaw dropped open when she told me how old she was.
The family was lost in the wilderness without any food or water, but they managed to find a way out and snatched victory from the jaws of defeat by surviving.
words.defineEn: the lower bone of the face containing the chin and the bottom teeth
words.defineVi: xương dưới của khuôn mặt chứa cằm và răng dưới
